bibl.title: Letter from Algernon Rose to Laura Armistead Carter, December 14, 1925

div1.p: Rose expresses regret at the death of Henry Rose Carter, thanks Laura Armistead Carter for her contribution to the Servants' Christmas Box Fund in Carter's name, and expresses pleasure that the reports of the Authors' Club were of interest to Carter.

Dear Madam,
div1.p:
Permit me to thank you for your letter of the 30th
Novr. It was a matter of extreme regret to us to hear of the
death of your father, Surgeon-General Henry Rose Carter, a very
valued member of the Authors' Club.

Not having your address, I sent, by wish of the
Committee, a vote of condolence to his “next-of-kin”, and I hope
that that message, of our sympathy with you in your sad bereavement,
reached you.

It is some consolation to hear that your father was
able to finish the chief part of his History of Yellow Fever, and
Miss L. A. Carter.
to send the completed MS to the editor of the Bulletin before he
passed away.

It is more than kind of you to send, in his name, a
Money Order for £1 towards the Servants' Christmas Box Fund. I can
assure you that this touching tribute to his memory is very much
appreciated. His name has been placed in the card in the hall
and I enclose the receipt herewith.

It is most thoughtful of you to inform us that the
reports of the fortnightly discussions in the Authors' Club were
of interest to Dr. Carter. The last dinner was to have been on
St. Andrew's Night, and we had arranged for a large gathering.
Sir Robert Horne was coming as the guest of the evening, but at the
last moment, the arrangements had to be cancelled, owing to the
sudden illness and death of his mother.

We will send you the remaining reports for this year,
and I trust that, when they reach you, they will recall the regard
and affection with which your father was held by authors generally.
div1.closer:
With renewed expressions of sympathy with you, I am,
dear madam,
Yours very truly, Algernon Rose. Hon. Secretary.
